letter from 12.11.2008.New Data were reported on
conference NICE 2007. See Entry O1697.

bib_record.title: Measurements of nucleon-induced fission cross-sections of separated tungsten isotopes and natural tungsten in the 5-200 MeV energy region.

free_txt: Department of neutron research and the
Svedberg Laboratory (TSL), Uppsala University.
Preliminary results.
Data were reanalysed by authors.New data were reported
to NICE2007.
The broad proton beam facility at TSL
the Svedbegrg Laboratory, Uppsala University.
Correction to fission event counting rates,
connected with-
1.  Thin-film breakdown counters fission chambers
detection efficiency taking into account charge,
mass,kinetic energy distributions of fission  fragments
and influence of angular anisotropy and linear momentum
transfer,
2. Background of fission events due presence of heavy
fissile admixtures in aluminum backings.
-By authors: absolute (p,f) cross sections for
separated isotopes of tungsten W-182,183,184 and 186
and W-natural have been obtained by multiplication of
the measured cross section ratios to the parameterized
the Bi-209(p,f) cross section.
Thin-film breakdown counters fission chambers.
The number of detector-target sandwiches=4, their
sensitive area 2.3-cm**2 in the mosaic arrangements.
The mosaic arrangements were irradiated in pairs and
one of them was used as a relative monitor of the
proton flux. The proton flux was monitored by
detection of protons scattered by a 0.1-mm thick
stainless steel exit window of the beam line at an
angle of about 45-degree by means of a scintillation
telescope.
Maximal total statistical uncertainty of
relative results for proton measurements above
90-MeV.
.See above but only below 60-MeV.
Statistical uncertainty.
The broad proton beam facility at TSL
the Svedbegrg Laboratory, Uppsala University.
The design of the thin-film breakdown counters fission
chambers.
Metal powder of separated isotopes of tungsten were
transformed to W/O3 chemical form, deposited on
aluminum backings by evaporation in vacuum.
Thickness of deposited layers about 2-mg/cm**2,
defined by direct weighting and by Rutherford
backscattering alpha-particles.
In text
Data for (n,f) reaction.
